summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that FedEx billing records (Government Exhibits 801-803) are authentic business records and that the stipulation itself (Exhibit 1002) may be admitted as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case S2 20 CR 330, who, through her attorneys, agrees to the stipulation regarding the authenticity of FedEx records.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signs the stipulation on behalf of the government.

persons.name: Christopher Everdell
persons.context: An attorney for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell who consents to the stipulation.

events.title: Stipulation on FedEx Evidence
events.description: The prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case file a joint stipulation agreeing that FedEx billing records (Government Exhibits 801-803) are authentic business records and that the stipulation itself (Exhibit 1002) may be admitted at trial.

keyFacts: The prosecution and defense jointly stipulated to the authenticity of FedEx billing records (Exhibits 801-803) as business records.
The stipulation itself was marked as Government Exhibit 1002 and was agreed to be admissible as evidence at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The document shows the legal team representing Ghislaine Maxwell as of November 2021: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
Damian Williams was the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York overseeing the prosecution.
The case is identified as S2 20 CR 330 (AJN), indicating it is a superseding indictment in the 2020 criminal case.
